description: After weighing her options, Rada Miskovic chooses not to release her full exposé on BCI abuses. Instead, she broadcasts unfiltered reports from protest zones and Halden Zones, showing daily hardships and growing unrest.

With tensions high and public anger mounting, the Directorate launches the 'Harmony Reset.' Services are cut to districts with low BCI scores and active protests, further isolating vulnerable neighborhoods.

Power outages and transit shutdowns hit protest and Halden Zones. Scenes of residents queuing for basic services and attempting to cross into compliant districts go viral, driving home the system's brutality.

Council records show confusion and internal rifts as even compliant, high-scoring neighborhoods experience random BCI failures. Directorate faces pushback from Harmonists and Innovators over punitive measures.
Harmonist and Innovator Council factions demand an end to the Harmony Reset, threatening a Council walkout unless services are restored citywide.
